choices.A: A field is a table row.
choices.B: A field is an item that appears in a menu list.
choices.D: A field is a record in a table.
choices.C: A field is a table cell that stores data.

questions.question_text: Which best describes a field in a ServiceNow table?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. A field is a table cell that stores data.
Record is a raw on table. so D is not correct.

Selected Answer: C
C - a field is a cell in the table
c is correct

Selected Answer: C
It's C. A row is a record.

Selected Answer: D
The answer is D per the following ServiceNow Doc link. Technically, C and D are both correct but ServiceNow uses the word "record". In the world of databases of course a field is a piece of data in a cell. Yet, I will remind you that ServiceNow likes the word record. I will also say that the term in all the ServiceNow training uses the phrase 'everything in ServiceNow is a record in a table'.

https://docs.servicenow.com/en-US/bundle/tokyo-platform-user-interface/page/use/using-forms/concept/c_FormFields.html

Selected Answer: C
Record is a row in a table.

Selected Answer: C
it's c not d

Selected Answer: C
C is the correct answer. D would be a record is a row. A field is a column!!!!!!

Selected Answer: C
C is the correct answer. D would be a record!!!!!!

Selected Answer: C
"A field represents an individual item of data on a record."
So it is a data, not a record.
C is the correct answer. D is correct if there is only one column.

Its C
given the choice between C & D

the question specifically says 'Which best describes a field in a ServiceNow table'
a record in a table contains multiple cells, in fact it is an entire row. so you should rule out D for the same reason you ruled out A!
it is a single cell in that row, which can contain data, or a single reference to another record.

Selected Answer: C
A field is the table column so closest description from the options is to a single cell of a record.
A record would be the row of a table so definitely not D.

Selected Answer: C
a field is not a record

Selected Answer: C
a field is not a record

Selected Answer: C
C is the correct answer

Selected Answer: D
Answer id D

Answer is D
Fields=Stores specific data about the record.

Selected Answer: D
https://docs.servicenow.com/en-US/bundle/tokyo-platform-user-interface/page/use/using-forms/concept/c_FormFields.html

Selected Answer: C
C is correct
C. C is correct

Selected Answer: D
I don't think is C
CDE correct answer

Selected Answer: CDE
C. Form Buttons
D. Form Context Menu
E. Form Links

Selected Answer: CDE
100 % CDE
CDE is correct. Page 436 of the ServiceNow Administration Fundamentals - Tokyo Edition.
CDE is correct

Selected Answer: CDE
CDE is the correct answer

questions.question_text: What are examples of UI Actions relating to forms? (Choose three.)

choices.C: Users which are members of either ACME North America, or HR Department, or ACME Managers group
choices.A: Members of the ACME Manager group, who are also members of HR Department and part of ACME North America
choices.D: Members of the ACME Managers group, and HR department, regardless of geography
choices.B: Employees of ACME North America, who are members of HR Department or the ACME Managers group

questions.question_text:
Here is an example of the criteria set for a knowledge base:
• Companies: ACME North America
• Departments: HR
• Groups: ACME Managers
• Match All: Yes

In this example, what users would have access to this knowledge base?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A - match all = yes
so ALSO and AND are the hint

Selected Answer: A
it's A
None of the above? Seems to be a common thing on these questions. A is close but the group name is specified as Mangers but the answer says Manager so.....

Selected Answer: A
A is the correct answer

questions.question_text:
A customer has asked for the following updates to a form:
• Make Resolution code Mandatory, when state is changed to Resolved
• Hide Major Incident check box, unless logged in user has Major Incident Manager role

What type of rule(s) would you use to implement this requirement?
